title: Anti-Trump rallies draw tens of thousands across the United States
summary: A loose coalition of dozens of left-leaning groups like MoveOn and Women's March organized 'Hands Off' events in more than 1,000 cities and in every congressional district on Saturday, the groups said. In Washington, organizers had predicted a turnout of 20,000 but by the afternoon, the number appeared considerably larger.

title: Humanitarian workers in Gaza are powerless against Israel's 'war without limits'
summary: More than 1,200 Palestinians have been killed since Israeli bombings resumed on March 18. Israel has deprived the Palestinian territory of any aid for over a month. Supplies are running out, and the health system has been targeted.

title: PSG clinches another French football title, extending dominance over Ligue 1
summary: Thanks to their win (1 - 0) against Angers on Saturday at the Parc des Princes, Paris Saint-Germain ensured their 13th first-place finish in the French championship. This dominance affects the league's appeal.

title: In Italy, Giorgia Meloni imposes her security law by decree
summary: The Italian prime minister has enacted legislation that includes protection for law enforcement in cases of accusations of police violence. Some of the most controversial articles were removed under the influence of the Italian president, Sergio Mattarella.

title: French restaurants experience rising failure rate amidst customer confidence crisis
summary: Insolvencies in this sector are at an all-time high. Fewer customers are coming in, driven away in particular by rising menu prices. Restaurant margins have shrunk.

title: John Nelson, American conductor and Berlioz champion, passes away
summary: The American maestro, who served as the music director of the Ensemble Orchestral de Paris for 10 years, died on March 31 at the age of 83.

title: US to revoke all visas for South Sudanese
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio complained the African nation was not accepting its nationals expelled from the United States. It was the first such measure singling out all passport holders from a particular country since Donald Trump returned to the White House.

title: UK governing party suspends MP Dan Norris after rape arrest
summary: The MP for North East Somerset and Hanham in South West England was elected to Parliament in 2024, defeating high-profile Conservative MP Jacob Rees-Mogg.  He was arrested on Friday, on suspicion of sexual offences against a girl and rape.

title: Wall Street plunges after China reacts to Trump's tariffs
summary: China's response to the tariffs announced by Donald Trump has intensified panic in the markets, which are unable to manage such a level of uncertainty.

title: In Spain, tens of thousands march across the country to protest the growing housing crisis
summary: The housing crisis has hit particularly hard in Spain, where there is a strong tradition of home ownership and scant public housing for rent. Buying a home has become unaffordable for many, with market pressures and speculation driving up prices, especially in big cities and coastal areas.

title: Le Pen's 'Plan B' stood for Bardella – until it became likely
summary: The far-right Rassemblement National party is refusing to prepare Jordan Bardella for the 2027 presidential election, fearing it would weaken Marine Le Pen, who is hoping to overturn her ban on running in elections.

title: Trump tells Americans to 'hang tough,' trade war 'won't be easy'
summary: The US president defiantly doubled down on his tariff policy that took effect and promised that 'the end result will be historic.'

title: Januar Land Rover suspends shipments to US in April over tariffs
summary: The UK luxury car manufacturer said it needed to address 'the new trading terms' created by Washington's tariffs.

title: Meet Michel Gaubert, the man behind fashion show soundtracks
summary: During the last Paris fashion week, he set the collections of six fashion houses to music. Since the 1990s, Michel Gaubert has been an indispensable presence on the catwalk scene.

title: Netanyahu expected to visit the White House on Monday
summary: President Donald Trump will meet with his Israeli counterpart on Monday for their second White House meeting since Trump's return to office. Tariffs, Gaza and Iran's nuclear program are expected to top the agenda.

title: Russian strike kills 18 in Zelensky's home city
summary: Russia's Ministry of Defense said on Friday it targeted Kryvyi Rig, 'where commanders of formations and Western instructors were meeting.'

title: Europe takes its time to respond to Trump's tariff offensive
summary: The European Commission still hopes to negotiate with Washington to mitigate the damage that the announced tariff increases would cause. The first wave of retaliations, initially set to take effect on April 1, have been postponed for some until mid-April and for others until mid-May.

title: In Spain, teenagers are as free as the air
summary: 'Parenting elsewhere.' Twice a month, one of our journalists overseas explores parenting beyond our borders. Spanish parents have no problem letting their offspring stay out until the late hours of the evening. Is this hands-off parenting or based on trust?

title: After Myanmar earthquake, citizens step in amid army's absence
summary: In Mandalay and Sagaing – two of the cities hardest hit by the earthquake that has claimed over 3,000 lives – local residents have organized their own relief efforts, supported by volunteers from Yangon.

title: At least 16 dead in flooding and tornadoes as storms slash from Texas to Ohio
summary: Day after day of heavy rains have pounded the central US, rapidly swelling waterways and prompting a series of flash flood emergencies. Forecasters warned that rivers in some places would continue to rise for days.

title: The invisible army of Ukrainian volunteers: 'Without them, the country's defense and society would have suffered enormous losses'
summary: Since the Russian invasion, over 71% of the population has been involved in voluntary work, one of the pillars of the resistance. Everyone contributes in their own way to the war effort in all areas related to the conflict.

title: US Congress in shock over Trump's trade war
summary: The US president's announcement on Wednesday to significantly increase tariffs shocked many lawmakers, including those in his own party. Some Republicans no longer hesitate to criticize the policy.

title: 'Whatever Trump has in mind, we now take his whims seriously.' A letter from a Canadian to his French friends
summary: Brian Myles, director of the Canadian daily 'Le Devoir,' urges people not to underestimate the threats Donald Trump is posing and reaffirms Canada's unique identity, which is exposed to the appetite of its imposing neighbor.

title: 'Kabul': Tracing the chaotic withdrawal of US troops from Afghanistan
summary: The series created by Olivier Demangel and Thomas Finkielkraut and starring Jonathan Zaccaï as a French diplomat is interesting in form but suffers from a lack of dramatic tension.

title: French far-right to stage rally in support of convicted Le Pen
summary: The far-right Rassemblement National is set to hold a rally in Paris on Sunday, days after leader Marine Le Pen was convicted of embezzlement and banned from running in elections.

title: Massive protests against Trump: 'People are losing their jobs, money and pension'
summary: Tens of thousands of people rallied across all states on Saturday under the slogan 'Hands off' to protest the White House's abuse of power – just days after Donald Trump announced new sweeping tariffs.

title: Rony Brauman: 'It's not America First but America Only!'
summary: The former president of Doctors Without Borders France says the Trump administration's halt to foreign aid funding is 'a decision at least as serious and perverse as the invasion of Iraq in 2003.'

title: In Tel Aviv, Saturday protests are where anger against Netanyahu converges
summary: Every week, Israelis take to the streets in a multifaceted protest with a common thread of animosity toward the prime minister. The dissent is amplified by the resumption of bombings in Gaza.

title: Pope Francis makes surprise appearance in Saint Peter's Square
summary: Francis was wheeled through the crowd in his first public appearance at the Vatican since his release from the hospital two weeks ago.

title: Tariffs: Will iPhones become more expensive? Answering your questions on Trump's announcements
summary: What impact will the tariffs have on American or European consumers? What political logic is driving these decisions? Many Le Monde readers asked about the consequences of the American tariffs.
